title: How big is Donald Trump's vocabulary? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are you actually asking how many words he uses in English? He’s a best selling author of a number of books - and whether some were ghost written or not, he would have played a part in every book. He’s also been President for several years that speaks around the world constantly. He graduated from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania in 1968, with a Bachelor of Science degree in economics and anthropology. It’s been reported that his IQ was 156 by one media outlet that was not highly reputed, and leftist media jumped on it. However,  Snopes.comThe definitive Internet reference source for urban legends, folklore, myths, rumors, and misinformation.http://Snopes.com  fact-checked the story and wrote that Trump’s IQ score “was between 145 and 149, not 156.” Good grief. That still places him in the top 15 Presidents by IQ of all time. He is still at least 5–10 points higher than Abraham Lincoln and George Washington (both at 140). Ulysses S. Grant had the lowest of the Presidents, at 120. According to Brainmetrix.com: “If you have an IQ range of 140 and over, it means you are a genius or almost genius. 120 - 139 : With an IQ of 120 to 139, it means you have very superior intelligence and your intelligence is better than most.” Meaning that every single American President was ranked with superior intelligence. Leftists need to lay off on Trump’s intelligence - it’s a game they won’t win. According to the New York Times, President Trump’s dad, Fred Trump, “died in 1999 with an estimated net wealth between $250 million and $300 million”. Fortune wrote in 2018: “President Trump's 2018 net worth at $3.1 billion.﻿ That makes him the 259th-richest person in the country. While Trump dropped eleven spots on Forbes' ranking as compared to the previous year and slid 138 spots since he announced his presidential bid in 2015, he is nevertheless one of the wealthiest U.S. presidents.” You dont take a $300 million fortune and turn it into billions without some measured intelligence. And it’s laughable to state he was “one of the wealthiest” - for even using a very conservative value of $3.1 billion for Trump, according to “24/7 Wall Street’s” 2016 valuation of each president's peak net worth; “President Trump’s worth is equal to more than every other President combined. plus several hundred $billion. The 2nd richest was George Washington worth $587 million.”

You can cite studies, reports, analysis by experts, and whatever. But your most reliable guide is to hear him speak. You get a lot of “strongly, tremendous, like you’ve never seen before, incredible, bigly, huge,” and the other words like that. Some say this is fourth-grade language. I was prepared to give Trump the benefit of the doubt and suggest that he tailored his language to his base (make of that what you will), but you would expect than in a setting among his peers like other national leaders, US lawmakers and government (both federal and state) officials, he might adopt a slightly more er, let’s go with sophisticated, language. Alas and alack he has not because he cannot. There is no way that Trump has read the bible nor any possibility that he had even skimmed Hitler’s writing. I could chuck a bunch of examples here where he talks about nuclear and government and plans but if you wanted to see that, you are quite capable of finding them. That you cannot or do not suggests that you don’t want to. Which is fine. Everyday, Trump provides more and more examples of his lack of vocabulary and language skills. Someone pointed out that our vocabulary deteriorates with age. Perhaps. So I sought videos of interview with him going back to the 70s. He was a little bit more lucid, the sentences were better structured, the train of thought left the station and arrived more or less where it was meant to go. But language-wise, not a whole lot of difference. My qualifications for saying this: I was a journalist for a national paper for 25 years, specifically a sub-editor whose job is fact-checking and making sure that news reports were lucid and could be read by the average reader. The language of the news reports differed markedly from that in the editorial and op-ed pages. Most readers skip those pages and the tone there is a little more serious and academic, deliberately. Man bites dog stories don’t appear there. More like the philosophy of humans biting domestic animals type of commentary. In short, Trump has a tiny vocabulary (matches his hands). Read everything he writes in tweets, listen to his speeches (scripted and off-the-cuff). It’s quite apparent.

Very small - view linguist Dr John Wcwhorter’s analysis of Trump’s use of language on Youtube. He notes thatTrump claims to have been to all the best schools and been a star student throughout yet, as McWhorter says “ it was all quite clearly wasted”. Look at a Trump speech. He cannot phrase an idea, there is little logic in his development of a theme, his vocabulary is narrow, and his coverage of any topic is superficial showing he has minimal understanding. He cannot answer questions rather jumps on to formulaic phrases, or throws insults, before trying to detract away from that asked. Unfortunately some people, although a decreasing number, are taken in. Claims of high IQ, successful businessman, great author etc. all come from Trump own self inflation. There is no external information to show these to be true - rather external information suggests precisely the opposite.

It is widely accepted by professionals that his vocabulary is around the age of a 9 yr old or fourth grade level He has never expressed any ability to speak at a higher level than that. His vocabulary is extremely small basic and simple. He cannot create complex sentences. He has no concept if paragraphs. He cannot speak intelligently on any subject. Literally. Everyone with experience of him in school or college has one opinion. Trump was the most god damn worst student they ever had. No one ever says wow what a smart guy. He left an impression if being a bully and utterly stupid. It certainly has made his mark. He could not pass even basic tests including a vocabulary. He paid someone to take his SATs. His father paid a lot of money to get him into Wharton. As far as IQ goes, the consistent ‘kitchen table talk’ is he is somewhere in the mid 80's. My professional opinion varies. I can get by with that gracious number. No one of any level of professionals available who would sign off on his delusions he has about himself. That's serious malpractice. Left on his own, he could get admission to community college . He wouldn't get in a college with a moderate admissions process. That's based solely on his behavior and manner of speech.

Old age can effect vocabulary, and at 76, I often need a thesaurus to find words I KNOW used to come to me without effort, something doctors tell me is to be expected. Age isn't my only hindrance; I was diagnosed with High Functioning Autism when I was 67, and never DID have a good short-term memory. A few “minor” strokes and cardiac problems didn’t help. The President is younger than I am and should be much more flexible in his utterances than I am — yet he very often isn’t. From STAT, Trump wasn’t always so linguistically challenged. What could explain the change? By SHARON BEGLEY @sxbegle MAY 23, 2017 (excerpts): In interviews Trump gave in the 1980s and 1990s (with Tom Brokaw, David Letterman, Oprah Winfrey, Charlie Rose, and others), he spoke articulately, used sophisticated vocabulary, inserted dependent clauses into his sentences without losing his train of thought, and strung together sentences into a polished paragraph, which — and this is no mean feat — would have scanned just fine in print. This was so even when reporters asked tough questions about, for instance, his divorce, his brush with bankruptcy, and why he doesn’t build housing for working-class Americans. … … Reagan’s speech was riddled with indefinite nouns (something, anything), “low imageability” verbs (have, go, get), incomplete sentences, limited vocabulary, simple grammar, and fillers (well, basically, um, ah, so) — all characteristic of cognitive problems. That suggested Reagan’s brain was slipping just a few years into his 1981-1989 tenure; that decline continued. He was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease in 1994. Bush showed no linguistic deterioration; he remained mentally sharp throughout his 1989-1993 tenure and beyond. Trump used to be more articulate. What could explain the change? This has been looked into. From the UK’s The Independent, Mr Trump scores the lowest of any of the past 15 presidents, by Emily Shugerman, Tuesday 09 January 2018 16:57 (excerpt): An analysis of the President's first 30,000 words uttered in office found Mr Trump speaks at a third- to seventh-grade reading level – lower than any other President since 1929. Mr Trump’s vocabulary and grammatical structure is “significantly more simple, and less diverse” than any President since Herbert Hoover, the analysis found. The comparison is based on interviews, speeches and press conferences for every president dating back to 1929, compiled by online database Factba.se. Analysts at Factba.se studied the “off-script” remarks of all 15 men – essentially, everything but their prepared speeches – to compare and contrast their speaking skills. Donald Trump speaks at the level of an 8-year-old, analysis finds Sic transit gloria mundi — Thus passes worldly glory.

Hard to say. Even though it sounds like it’s solely comprised of “I,” “my,” “believe me,” “tremendous,” “shithole,” “huge,” “loser,” “Ivanka,” and “hot,” I’m sure it’s got to be bigger. As far as vocabulary usage, most credible sources have him speaking at a 4th grade level. To be fair, Mr. Trump’s usage appears to have been at a higher level when he was younger, meaning that he’s either had some cognitive decline (as suggested by a group of psychiatrists headed by Bandy Lee, MD) or, as an acknowledged master of “sizing up” his audience, speaking at the 4th grade level may be pure strategy. Of course, countering this is one of his “Wharton” professors calling him “the dumbest student I’ve ever had.” But I’m sure that comfortably retired prof is just a disgruntled employee who’s envious of Mr. Trump’s success.

It doesn’t seem to be very large. He uses the same words over and over again, especially adjectives like “beautiful”, “wonderful”, and “perfect.” He also uses the same adverbs over and over again, especially “strongly”, which he employs in statements like “I am looking at it strongly” or “Putin denied meddling in our elections very strongly.” He also has famously attached the ungrammatical adjective “bigly” to describe certain situations. There are those who say that his vocabulary has deteriorated quite a lot in the last ten years and that this is evidence that he may be dealing with some cognitive decline. But whatever the reason, at this point in his life, Trump definitely draws his words from the same small vocabulary again and again.

Judging from his speeches, his vocabulary is limited. And if anyone thinks that Trump “wrote” a single book, talks to someone like Tony Schwartz. Trump has not only never actually written one, he hasn’t read one. Cheated his way into Wharton(NOT the business school, the rigors of that were were beyond his capability) and one of Trump’s professors said that the was the goddam stupidest student he’d ever had. Couple Trump’s intellectual laziness with his cognitive decline and you’ve got a vocabulary that’s “Yuge! Bigly! Like no one has ever seen!”.

I have no idea. He speaks in a conversational speaking style, which is defined as being less formal and less complex. Donald Trump has attended several universities although I cannot recall all of his academic history, I know he at least has a bachelor's and atttended an Ivy League university. This means at the VERY least he is fluent in English and has the basics of one other language. I appreciate a tendency of his that is highly contentious to the media- he asks laymen's questions to authorities (of their field), when he doesn't understand or there is uncertainty. To many this behavior may seem as if he is ignorant and it is definitely not the way we perceive or expect The President to act- but that is complete nonsense. It actually shows that he is a) a good learner b) translating terms and/or concepts that may be confusing to the general public c) asks questions he thinks un-knowledgeable people may ask. I think Trump is intelligent, if not suffering from megalomania, and I would assume his vocabulary is extensive in the area of his expertise (economics/business)

I’ve heard various estimates, and can’t remember most of them. But I seem to remember someone who counted the words in one of his major speeches. That count was 86. These words were used repeatedly, of course, so, in one sense, it could said trump uttered 860,000 words (or whatever number). But, remember: this would be the same 86 words spoken 10,000 times. There could be a mathematical computation of how many times each word was used, but I’d have to read the speech, myself, and I just can’t face that right now. So, just off the top of my head, I’ll do a compendious guesstimate: “The:” 15,000 repetitions. “A” or “an:” 100,000 repetitions “Obama:” 800 repetitions “Obama,” combined with “worst president ever: 800 repetitions. And on and on like that. So I’ll just shut myself down.

Trump’s vocabulary despite the FAKE NEWS and bad press COVFEFE is INCREDIBLE, HUGE. BELIEVE ME his words are CLASSY full of TREMENDOUS FIRE AND FURY not the words of a STUPID LOSER with ZERO common sense, but a GREAT pretender who who claims the secret to WINNING BIGLY is eating lots of HAMBERDERS. He says he has A LOT OF MONEY, MILLION AND BILLIONS don’t believe me YOU’LL FIND OUT if THEY ever finish his audit. Counting his favorites I used above. I figure Trump’s vocabulary is well over 100 words.

About 20,000 words, same as average Fourth grader. He misuses many higher grade level words because he doesn’t understand how the word might have a different connotation when used in other situations. Also having the general knowledge level of a fourth grader he misses entirely words being used allegorically and takes them as meaning the concrete thing. For examples, he once believed that “bleaching emails” means printing out the emails on paper and dipping them in bleach. Similarly he still believes that bleaching hard drives is expensive and nearly impossible to do. In another instance he actually believes the F-35 stealth aircraft is invisible to the human eye, rather than almost entirely invisible to radar. Most aides know he will fly into a blind rage if his misunderstanding about anything is corrected.

Unfortunately I cannot answer this question very well. From my limited knowledge, Trump’s vocabulary appears to be extremely minimal from the times when I have heard him speak. That is particularly true when he speaks extemporaneously. When Trump speaks from a written speech which is probably written for him by a speechwriter, he appears to have a slightly more impressive vocabulary. However, when he does speak from a prewritten speech, he often mispronounces some of the words which indicates that he is not familiar with those words or has not bothered to practice the speech before delivering it. That is the best I can do in answering this question.

400 words tops. Bigly, yuge, incredible, unbelievable are most often used. But please notice that two of the words he made up. He seems smarter when he reads from a teleprompter. But all he is doing is reading, often quite poorly. His flights of fancy has American fighter planes destroying the English airfields during the Revolutionary war. So even when professionals write speeches for him, his flights of fancy take over and away he goes, telling us of his incredible accomplishments and what a great president he is. Really? Yes, his daily goal using his limited vocabulary is to make himself appear to be the yugeist, most bigly president we ever had.

When asked by a reporter what his plan is for the next four years, this is Trump’s reply: “I think, I think it would be, I think it would be, very, very, I think we’d have a very, very solid, we would continue what we’re doing, and we have other things on our plate” In answer to your question: No, Trump doesn’t have a big vocabulary. In fact, a two-year old has a bigger vocabulary than Trump does. Bigly.

Vocabulary (size of) has been used as a measure of intelligence. It works pretty well. The stupid have a very limited vocabulary. The smart have a richer vocabulary. The very smart people, however, recognize that using “big” words doesn’t help you communicate with the “average Joe or Josephine”. Nobody who wants to communicate to the masses would use a “big” vocabulary — for at least two reasons. First, many people would not understand you. Second (in reference to Adli Stevenson, some guy who ran for President of the USA) if the populace perceives that you use “big” words, they won’t vote for you.

Sorry I can not answer this question but I can refer you to Professor John McWhortes as he is a Linguistic expert and he told his audience that trump managed the vocabulary that of a five year old. I watch Professor Doing an interview and I think it was on CNN where he went into detail how trump speaks and at which level his vocabulary is. Everybody should see this interview and you will learn quickly that trump is not what he profess to be, not even close.

For an average person, say high school grad, trumps vocabulary is around there. For a president or anyone else in a job requiring public speaking he far below average. It's not just the words, it's the sentences, the way he puts things together. People who don't read a lot and don't really listen to other people tend to have a limited communication skills. Trump fits that bill. Trump need not come across as a dumbass, he is smart enough to do better, but he probably won't.

Trump is a functioning illiterate. He rarely attended classes and his Father bought his “diplomas.” Trump lost the entire $446 million his Father left him. He then asked the Russians for help. Trump has been a Russian operative for over 34 years. Additionally, Trump is categorically insane.

TRUMP IS IN THE NEWS EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK. HIS VOCABULARY OR LACK OF IS EVIDENT IN ANY STATEMENT HE EVER MADE. THE SUPPORTERS OF TRUMP HAVE PROVEN TO SUPPORT AN UNQUALIFIED PERSON, ONLY BECAUSE OF ANGER. IT WAS PURLEY A VOTE AGAINST INSTEAD OF A VOTE IN SUPPORT OF SOMEONE. THE ONLY REASON WHY HE WAS EVER THOUGHT OF AS A PROSPECTIVE PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE WAS HIS HISTORY ON T. V. AS A BUSINESS LEADER AND THE SHOW “THE APPRENTICE”. EVERYTHING HE EVER GAINED TO HIS CREDIT WAS ACCOMPLISHED BY HIS LAWYERS, HIS FATHER TAUGHT HIM WELL.

Who knows? He uses the vocabulary of a 6th-grader. He may be doing it on purpose to appeal to redneck peckerwoods who still support him. I’m tired of hearing bullshit about Wharton. He transferred to UPenn so he did not have to meet the admittance criteria. He only got a BS. When i was an engineering student in Philly the joke was: Lim(IQ->0) Engineering = Business For the record, i was asked to do a PhD in Trump’s adopted alma mater for free, without applying.
Donald Trump Speaks Like Fourth Grader, POTUS Has Worst Vocabulary But ‘More Relatable’ Yuge, great, incredible. The bestest 4th grade vocabulary any unpresidented stable genius ever had.

Its obvious Trump is not an orator. I don't think there is any president who has had such a limited comand of the english language. It's hard to believe this man did well in school. His knowledge of words is so limited, l almost feel sorry for him. He has stupid phases he uses over and over until l want to scream. If he was your professor in school and you wanted to be a public speaker, l think you'd change teachers or schools

It really doesn’t seem to be anything overtly special. I do not take him for anything remotely close to what he believes he is… A genius? Absolutely not! Maybe a slow Jr. High Schooler… His vocabulary in terms of bullying, seems to be above average… It seems he may have a “Book of Derogatory Names a Scared Adult Uses on Those He is Jealous Of” His latest issue calling war veterans “Losers and Suckers” is just one more in a long line of disgusting childish activities donald trump is well known for doing… Naturally, he’s denying it… However, IMO it’s too much too late and come Nov. 3rd, America will speak out on how they truly feel about it!!! Trump is in absolutely no way the person we want running our country…

I’ve always thought he has the vocabulary of an 8 year old. Then I googled the average vocabulary for that age, and it turns out it’s 10,000 words. There’s no way Trump has a vocabulary that big, so it will have to be 4,000 words, or as many as a 4 year old.

It’s bigger than we think. He just doesn’t use sophisticated, complex language when he speaks at public events. Mainly because he knows that fake news is going to eat it up, and project that he is mentally unstable to protect creepy Joe Biden.

When I was in the first grade many, many years ago, the reading primer was called “Alice and Jerry At Home”! It was a first grade vocabulary builder! I think that it introduced maybe 200 new words! Trump's vocabulary pretty much stopped at a first grade level vocabulary! I muchly think that is about it!

His vocabulary now as compared to the 1990s? His current vocabulary of words he can use correctly in intelligible language appears to be about 8,000 to 10,000. (3rd grade level) Add to that about 250 superfluous adjectives that he piles on even when they have no meaning. His sentence structure implies less than 5,000 words that he has full command of. These numbers and his sentence structure capability has been shrinking throughout his time in office.

Probably about the 6th grade level. He uses the same words incorrectly and does it often. Example would be bigley. I never thought it absolutely necessary for a president to be a great orator, but it is essential that he can express his thoughts. Trump can’t.

I don’t know, no idea, but it seems to be declining fast. Look at him just a few months ago and look at him now. He is a mere muddy reflection of his former self. Unless he sees that he’s going to lose the presidency one way or another and he’s building up a case for being mentally unfit to stand trial. That will insulate him at least a little bit.

Trump said, “I have the best words.” Covfefe? One can’t judge Trump’s vocabulary by the dumb downed speeches he gives his followers. In private his speech is more filled with the sort of expletives deleted from the Nixon tapes. At best, Trump’s vocabulary is average.

Based on his spoken and written words, limited, to say the least. It could be comparedto that of a reasonably intelligent fifth-grader. His continued use of simple terms like “nasty” and “terrible” are examples of this. I would expect that a college graduate would have a more extensive. Choice of words.

Well, “many things,” “things” and “various things” cover a lot of ground. Why does he need any more vocabulary than that? He’s got his base to clear this up, with Trump Explaining Syndrome (TES), which we can surely count on.

I read an analysis last week of his vocabulary. He uses the same words over and over again. Two syllable words and occasionally three syllable words. He is unfamiliar with many more complicated words and often mispronounces them as he’s reading off the teleprompter. It has been said his vocabulary is grade school—and not very bright grade schooler.
It’s very small and the words have very few syllables. There is lots on Youtube about it. He had's generously be rated as speaking at a 4th-grade level.

Trump has the most beautiful, most powerful vocabulary on the planet! Not because he knows a lot of words, but because he knows the best two words. Trump has all the best words, but the only two he uses are “beautiful” and “powerful.” When you have complete command of the words “beautiful” and “powerful,” why bother to learn any more? Shakespeare should have written “Hamlet” using just those beautiful, powerful words over and over and over again!

It’s tremendous uugely, trump has all the mostest bigliest words. Now, returning to earth from that alternative universe, trump has a fourth, or if the teleprompter is working and he can read, a fifth grade vocabulary.

This question reminds me of the question posed to Abraham Lincoln to wit: “How long should a person's legs be?” Lincoln answered “Long enough to reach the ground.” Perhaps the question might be better phrased “Does President Trump appear to have a large or a small vocabulary?”

I think he is capable of expressing anything he wants if this is the purpose that you are asking. He is a high productivity of twitter for years. This is not sleepy Biden can match. Trump will never be like Biden mumbling before the public but speaking out immediately after he just thought. Maybe you don’t agree but some people enjoying his speaking. He is unpredictable, but Biden is B..O..RING. Which one do you prefer?

Funny you should ask. I am well read and have a huge vocabulary, but I am also a salesmen and don’t use it to talk down to people, especially in negotiations. Academics have a real problem with this and think their broader vocabulary, which they use too much, makes them appear superior to others.
Trump’s vocabulary isn’t very large. Most of his words are in Basic English, with a few big words like tremendous, gigantic, and exceptionally and a few political terms thrown in for good measure.
About the same as the average 3rd or 4th grader. Unfortunately for trump, his use of English is degrading as opposed to the average 3rd and 4th grader whose English is improving.

Very weak vocabulary. He has trouble finding adjectives and synonyms, so he repeats at least 3 times everything he says. He gets worse every day. He is aging fast, and soon he will just be blurting out random words from the recesses of his dark mind. His vocabulary is lacking due to his disinterest in reading and learning.

As foul and ugly as what vomes out of his mouth, I would say very limited.He is not very smart. But as far as the con game, working the system, pilfering, lying and all the other attributes of a seasoned criminal; I suppose he doesn't need vocabulary for those.
Listen to him talk when he's NOT reading a teleprompter. Watch how many times he repeats words and phrases. He's still in the third grade. He is an illiterate.
Small and getting smaller.He uses the same words all of the time and has a few adjectives to enhance his word salad. tRump is impaired and is getting worse.

Well, there’s active vocabulary and passive vocabulary, so ? He does have a tendency to use certain words over and over ad nauseam. However, his democratic opposition doesn’t seem to be much of an orator so Donald Trump could get by with what he knows. Sorry I can’t be more specific and on point.

That depends on what resides in his mind plus, at any given moment, plus recent input from the scholarly wisdom-dispensers at Fox News. However, I suspect that the ”coming/going” quotient is tilting towards emptying and decline.

the average person only reads and comprehends at a 7th grade level. college educated included. i.q. tests no longer indicate permeant levels . it just shows you how smart or dumb you are on the test day . so how big is bigleys vocabulary is any ones guess.

He is not the smartest president so his IQ shouldn't be that how. He graduated close to the last at Wharton business school. He rarely leaves this Country so him giving speeches elsewhere outside the Country is not true. Don't give him credit when he doesn't deserve it.

Although it pains them, and they will not admit it, Trump is extremely intelligent. He’s a billionaire, was a successful TV star, producer, owns hotels and golf courses, and attended top schools. He uses words carefully and influences people powerfully. While leftist Democrats like to paint every GOP politician as a huge dummy, and every Dem politician as a blindingly brilliant genius, it just ain’t so. The billionaire isn’t a big stupid dummy-head. He’s pretty intelligent.
I often compare Trump's speaking abilities to that of a third grader. I'll be generous and say his vocabulary is about the equivalent to a 6th grader. Definitely not an intellectual.

I believe his ghostwriter for “Art of the Deal” suggested his vocabulary was at the second-grade level; this study highlighted by Newsweek suggests a fourth-grade level: that of a nine-year old. We probably all know at least one nine year old more articulate. Trump speaks at fourth-grade level, lowest of last 15 U.S. presidents, new analysis finds
He has the smallest vocabulary of any president ever. I’ve heard 7 year olds speak with more aplomb and certainly more appropriate words. The least that can be said is that he is not a thinker.
He's so STUPID, he wouldn't even have enough IQ points to read @ a KINDERGARTEN level!!!
My five year old great grandson has a bigger vocabulary, and comprehends what his words mean. Does that answer your question?
Donald Trump possesses above average intelligence, and the average person has a syntax of approximately 100,000 words. So I will quess around 115,000 words.
Psychologists and language arts instructors agree that is is in the range of fourth grade, elementary school level.
As far as I can tell, he has four words. Hoax, witch hunt and unfair.
It actually seems to be getting smaller by the week. Like when he told reporters we need to get to the “oranges” of the Russia investigation. Don’t you mean strawberries, Captain?
You must be kidding.......The question should be, “How small is his vocabulary?’......
Oh, it’s the bigly-est Dan. They say, and we’re hearing, that he has all the best words. And that’s what all of his polls are showing, so it must be true. Right? Thanks for asking.
Quite small actually never uses compound words and has trouble with pronunciation eg he says fatility for fatality
Very big… for a cat. Very small for a human.

Two words: weak and childish. This is a nonpolitical assessment. My ear doesn’t hear political affiliations. Anybody who repeats, relying on adverbs and superlatives as crutches, is not communicating from a place of strength. His limited vocabulary is on full display. “It’s great. The very best. Very great. The best one.” Yeah, that’s cringe-worthy. He’s no Obama, no Reagan, no Kennedy. They were orators.

how does one actually answer that ??? i know his vocabulary is better than mine ,… he just is not a good speaker, but then again he’s not a polished showboating politician, Trump is a businessman, and the USA is a business!

To borrow his often mimicked pronunciation “It's YUGE”. Not likely extraordinarily large, but the man is educated with a degree, it's a fairly safe assumption to guess he has what would be a slightly higher than normal but average among the college educated population

About a 5th grade level. Pathetic for a POTUS.
If you don’t count profanities, his vocabulary is about 150 words. The longest word he knows is six syllables: Hydroxychloroquine.

I think it would depend on whom he is speaking with. If the common man it would not be too broad but with a genius IQ he could have a very wide vocabulary to speak with dignitaries and educated people.
Well, he’s not smarter than a 5th Grader. I’d say 700 words or less.
Big enough to help him make millions of dollars and take the highest office in the US of A.
It would just be good if he added 'resign' to it.
It's the most bigly, yugely, winningiest, incredible, tremendous, never heard of before now, anti-fake news vocabulary of all US presidents past and future put together.

yuge, bigly, covfefe, I, me. He sounds like a snotty 8-year-old with his name-calling and monosyllabic vocabulary.
probably five words? “ fake news—-you are fired.”
Estimates put him anywhere from a 4th grade level to a 7th grade level of speaking.
Listening to his public statements, not very big. Listening to his responses to questions without a script in front of him, even smaller than I originally thought.

REALLY REALLY small!!!
The “N” word makes up about 25% of it. Another 25% is two syllable nick names.

If it wasn’t the speeches and facts written by the secretaries and the prompters to read of, his vocabulary would be fairly restricted. Even then he miss pronounces words a d Countries. I know he is “ The Greatest Ever” 🥱🤥
